subject: Re: [junit] How good it is to use JUnitEE?
msgSnippet: ... I don t know JUnitEE well, but I can suggest MockEJB (session beans and MDBs) and Cactus (any EJB). -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Mohammed Ashfaq wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> I have lots of EJBs with Service Adapter Layers/Request Handlers.
>
> I have to write Unit test Cases for the same.
> Can anyone suggest me a good approach and also how good it is to use JUnitEE
> TestRunner?

I don't know JUnitEE well, but I can suggest MockEJB (session beans and
MDBs) and Cactus (any EJB).
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
